fullText: The show is basically a two-man variety hour built around Kroll and Mulaney's elderly Upper West Side alter egos, Gil Faizon and George St. Geegland, characters so specifically observed and hilariously performed that they feel like documentary subjects.
dtliExcerpt: The show is basically a two-man variety hour built around Kroll and Mulaney's elderly Upper West Side alter egos, Gil Faizon and George St. Geegland, characters so specifically observed and hilariously performed that they feel like documentary subjects.
bwwExcerpt: What they are actually satirizing through the medium of their hideously bewigged and age-spotted alter egos is sometimes a bit fuzzy; the characters are both in on the jokes and the butt of them. But either way the jokes are excellent, as they should be by now; the Broadway incarnation ofOh, Hello - sleekly directed by Alex Timbers - follows a sold-out 2015 Off Broadway run, a national tour, and almost a decade of development. (Kroll and Mulaney based the characters on two men they saw shopping
